premium.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the cost of insurance, especially the amount that you pay each year
premium.translation[0].definitions[1].de: an additional amount of money, above a standard rate or amount
premium.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Consumers are prepared to pay a premium for organically grown vegetables.
Top quality cigars are being sold at a premium.
premium.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: the current consumer trend for premium products
premium.translation[2].definitions[0].de: a payment that you make for insurance
premium.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: Some insurance companies offer small sum policies, with monthly or annual premiums.
Car insurance premiums shot up by almost a quarter.
premium.translation[2].definitions[1].de: an additional amount of money, above a standard amount or rate
premium.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: The companyâ€™s earnings will grow by about 25% a year and investors will be willing to pay a premium (=pay more than usual) for that growth.
As long as there is a threat of war in the Middle Eastern oil fields, oil prices will command a premium (=buyers will have to pay more than usual).
premium.translation[2].definitions[2].de: if something is at a premium, there is little of it available or it is difficult to obtain
premium.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: With parking space at a premium in Japanese cities, the microcar is a popular form of transport.
premium.translation[2].definitions[3].de: if one thing is sold at a premium to another, it costs more
premium.translation[2].definitions[3].ex: Platinum usually trades at a premium to gold.
premium.translation[2].definitions[4].de: if you put a premium on something, you consider it to be especially valuable
premium.translation[2].definitions[4].ex: Employers today put a premium on reasoning skills and willingness to learn.
premium.translation[3].definitions[0].de: premium products, goods etc are of higher quality than usual
premium.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: Premium brands of beer will grow faster, in line with the trend toward people demanding better quality.
